problems.title: Maximum Length of a Concatenated String with Unique Characters (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an array of strings arr. A string s is formed by the concatenation of a subsequence of arr that has unique characters.
Return the maximum possible length of s.
A subsequence is an array that can be derived from another array by deleting some or no elements without changing the order of the remaining elements.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
un iq ue

Sample Output
4

Explanation: All the valid concatenations are:
- ""
- "un"
- "iq"
- "ue"
- "uniq" ("un" + "iq")
- "ique" ("iq" + "ue")
Maximum length is 4.

Sample Input
cha r act ers

Sample Output
6

Explanation: Possible longest valid concatenations are "chaers" ("cha" + "ers") and "acters" ("act" + "ers").

Sample Input
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz

Sample Output
26

Explanation: The only string in arr has all 26 characters.
problems.constraints:
1 <= arr.length <= 16
1 <= arr[i].length <= 26
arr[i] contains only lowercase English letters.

testCases.input: unique strings with no common characters
a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p

hintsList: Use bitmask to represent the set of characters in each string.
Use backtracking or dynamic programming to try all combinations of strings.
